tasks.task: Preparing a budget for strawberry production
subtasks: Review existing enterprise budget resources
Update projections for input costs (fertilizer, labor, etc.)
Consider seasonal labor requirements and cover crop benefits
Adjust for local climate differences (N/S Alabama)
Account for fluctuating market prices and supply chain issues

tasks.task: Managing variable costs in strawberry production
subtasks: Accurate soil and plant testing
Optimize fertilizer application rates
Monitor fungicide and chemical usage
Plan for row cover expenses and frost protection

tasks.task: Hiring and scheduling labor for strawberry production
subtasks: Anticipate peak labor needs (e.g., January-February)
Budget for multiple crop worker hires
Coordinate labor for timely tasks (e.g., row cover deployment)
Explore labor-saving alternatives (e.g., UPIC operations)

tasks.task: Marketing and sales strategies for strawberry production
subtasks: Consider direct-to-consumer sales (you-pick)
Balance fresh and wholesale markets
Price analysis for retail vs. processed/wholesale options
Evaluate value-added product opportunities
Track all variable and fixed costs annually
Review and adjust budgets based on previous year's data
Anticipate cost increases (e.g., fertilizer, fuel) for future planning
Utilize enterprise budgets as a planning tool
Stay informed about trends and best practices in the industry
